Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: この街の権力者はスカラベさんよ。 あの人がガジュマ嫌いだから、 それに逆らえない人もいるみたいよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Scarabe is a powerful person in this town. He hates Gajuma, and there are some people who can't stand up against him...
Entry.Notes: well it would be more accurate to say that none can stand against him, but the deepl is giving me something similar, so marking problematic just in case.

Entry.JapaneseText: 前からガジュマ嫌いの人は 多かったけど、最近、その雰囲気が 何倍にも強くなってるみたいなの……
Entry.EnglishText: This town has always had a lot of people who hate Gajuma, but lately it seems that hatred is growing exponentially...
Entry.Notes: I rewrote it. I want it checked.

Entry.JapaneseText: 半年くらい前に、私は他の街から ここに越して来たんだけど…… 最初はびっくりしたわ……
Entry.EnglishText: I arrived here from a different town around six months ago. It was quite surprising at first...

Entry.JapaneseText: 当たり前のように、 ヒューマがガジュマの事を 嫌ってるんだもの……
Entry.EnglishText: And, as you'd expect, Huma here absolutely detest Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた…… この街のガジュマにしては、 ずいぶんキレイな格好ね……
Entry.EnglishText: Hey... Compared to other Gajuma in this town, you wear such elegant clothes...
Entry.Notes: deepL says: You ...... For a Gajuma in this city, You're looking pretty good for a gajama in this town: ...... idk if they are talking about his clothes. Maybe: Ya know, compared to the other gajuma in town, you actually look pretty dapper.

Entry.JapaneseText: 下手に街を歩いて目立つと、 ヒューマたちにいじめられるわ。 早く仲間の所へ行ったほうがいいわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: People will pick on you if you walk around town, so you should hurry on back to your friends.
Entry.Notes: deepL says: If you walk down the street and stand out, Huma and the others will pick on you. You'd better get back to your friends.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた、その服装からいって、 スールズの子でしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Child, those clothes... Are you perhaps from Sulz?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah...

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズって、 おだやかでいい村よね…… 私もこんな街、早く出て、 スールズに行こうかなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz is quite a peaceful town, isn't it? I hope I can leave this place soon and move there...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちみたいに、 ヒューマとガジュマが一緒に いるのって、なんだかとても 新鮮に見えるわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Seeing Gajuma and Huma walking around together is quite a refreshing sight.

Entry.JapaneseText: 少し前までは、当たり前だった ような気がするんだけどな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems it was the norm not so long ago...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ヒューマとガジュマの 話し合いか……
Entry.EnglishText: A discussion amongst Huma and Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベさんも、 少しは反省したのかな…… 明日の会合には行かなくちゃね……
Entry.EnglishText: I hope Scarabe has reflected on himself a bit... I must come and witness the event tomorrow.

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様の演説を聞いてたら 涙が出ちゃったわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Agarte's speech has brought tears to my eyes...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私の住んでた街でも、 よくみんなで集まって、 楽しくやってた……
Entry.EnglishText: In the town I used to live in, we used to gather together and have fun...

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、ふるさとに帰りたく なっちゃったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh dear, now I'm feeling quite homesick.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……軍の人って、もめごとや ケンカは止めてくれるけど…… ヒューマとガジュマが仲良くなる のとは、別なのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: Those military men have been splendidly preventing fights from breaking out, but... making Huma and Gajuma get along is a different thing altogether.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたら、ガジュマの人たちと 仲良くできるのかしらね……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder how they would be able to persuade those Gajuma?
Entry.Notes: deepl says: How can I get along with the people of Gajuma? I wonder how we can get along with the Gajuma. ......

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様の演説の噂が広まってから、 ガジュマの兵隊さんの態度が とっても恐い感じなの……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of rumors about Lady Zilva's speech, the attitude of Gajuma Soldiers have gotten scarier...

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍の人がヒューマとか ガジュマとか言い出したら よくないと思うんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't think it's a good idea for military to talk about Gajuma, Huma, and whatnot...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、この前、ジャンニさんって ガジュマの女の人と会ったの。
Entry.EnglishText: I met a woman named Gianni the other day.

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々大変だけど、みんなが 仲良く暮らせるように、 協力するって約束したの。
Entry.EnglishText: A lot has happened. However, I've promised to give my all in living together with everyone.
Entry.Notes: deepl says: I know it's a lot of work, but I hope that we can all live together in harmony. I promised to cooperate with them so that we can all live in harmony.

Entry.JapaneseText: この音、いつまで続くのかしら？ 考え事したいのに、集中できなくって。
Entry.EnglishText: When will this sound end? I can't even hear myself think...

Entry.JapaneseText: ジャンニさんのがんばりのおかげで 少しずつ協力してくれる人が 増えてるみたい。
Entry.EnglishText: Because of Gianni's efforts, the amount of people cooperating has begun to slowly increase.

Entry.JapaneseText: すぐにはうまく行かなくても、 きっといつか……ね！
Entry.EnglishText: Peace might not be achieved immediately, but... Someday! Someday for sure!

Entry.JapaneseText: 私はよそ者だけど、 街のみんなと仲良くやってるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: I may be an outsider, but I get along with everyone in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが嫌いなふりも してるし……
Entry.EnglishText: Even though I have to pretend to hate Gajuma in the process...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私って世渡り上手？ それとも単なる 八方美人なのかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: Am I perhaps... a wise woman, or just a simple one?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『手ぬいのテーブルクロス』 この家の女の人が作って、道具屋に 卸しているテーブルクロス。 ベルサスの金持ちたちの間で人気。 半年先まで予約でいっぱい。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Hand-stitched Tablecloth - Made by the woman who lives here, these tablecloths are sold at the Item shop. A favorite amongst Belsas nobles. She's been fully booked for 6 months.
